verses.roman:
haridāsera pādodaka piye bhakta-gaṇa
haridāsera aṅge dilā prasāda-candana

synonyms: haridāsera—of Haridāsa Ṭhākura; pāda-udaka—the water that touched the lotus feet; piye—drink; bhakta-gaṇa—the devotees; haridāsera—of Haridāsa Ṭhākura; aṅge—on the body; dilā—smeared; prasāda-candana—remnants of sandalwood pulp offered to Lord Jagannātha.
translation: Everyone drank the water that had touched the lotus feet of Haridāsa Ṭhākura, and then they smeared remnants of Lord Jagannātha's sandalwood pulp over Haridāsa Ṭhākura's body.
